title: Propulsion Assignment
description: Analyze the thrust and efficiency characteristics of various propulsion systems, comparing jet and rocket engines under different atmospheric conditions.

title: Combustion Analysis
description: Evaluate the thermodynamic performance of combustion chambers by calculating fuel-air ratios, flame temperatures, and energy release rates.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description: Design an optimized rocket nozzle for maximum exhaust velocity and efficiency, incorporating expansion ratios and flow visualization analysis.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description: A short quiz covering key aerodynamic principles including lift, drag, and boundary layer behavior for subsonic and supersonic flow.

title: Flow Analysis
description: Simulate and analyze incompressible and compressible flow using computational methods to identify regions of turbulence and pressure variation.

title: Heating Analysis
description: Investigate thermal transfer in aerodynamic surfaces under varying Mach numbers, focusing on convective heat transfer and material response.

title: Structural Design Task
description: Perform finite element analysis on aerospace structural components to evaluate stress distribution, material fatigue, and load-bearing capacity.

title: Orbital Calculations
description: Calculate orbital parameters for satellites using Keplerâ€™s laws and Newtonian mechanics, including delta-v requirements for orbital transfers.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description: A comprehensive exam assessing understanding of integrated aerospace systems, mission planning, risk assessment, and subsystem coordination.
